results.title: Who should decide?
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film deals with questions arising from advances in pre-natal diagnosis. Joanne, a victim of spina bifida, discovers that her unborn child has the same disease. A decision whether to terminate the pregnancy must be reached quickly. When her husband says that all he ever wanted was “a normal baby,” Joanne counters with “What is normal?”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Beverly Shaffer, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Old person's friend
results.creator_credit: Annie O'Donoghue, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. An elderly woman, bedridden and with a history of strokes, refuses medical attention and creates a dilemma for the hospital’s staff. Should she be allowed to die as she wishes or should everything possible be done to preserve life?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Annie O’Donoghue, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: If you want a girl like me
results.creator_credit: Susan Huycke, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film looks at questions surrounding life-prolonging treatment for disabled newborns. When a teenage girl discovers that her newborn baby suffers from spina bifida and hydrocephalus, she refuses to agree to a life-saving shunt. While her boyfriend, the father, tries to convince her to accept responsibility for the infant, the hospital awaits their signed consent to proceed with the operation.
results.title_for_label: If you want a girl like me
results.creator_credit_for_label: Susan Huycke, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Happy birthday
results.creator_credit: Jefferson Lewis, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. A young couple’s marriage is threatened over a decision as to whether the husband should accept a job researching poison gas for military purposes. The wife is adamantly opposed. Regardless of their decision, someone will take the job. Should one morally accept responsibility for the consequences?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jefferson Lewis, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Family tree
results.creator_credit: Norman Bailey, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film examines the moral questions surrounding the issue of compulsory sterilization. When a child-beater and single mother of three is admitted to hospital in need of abdominal surgery, the surgeon is sorely tempted to perform a tubal ligation without the patient’s consent, thus preventing the birth of “new victims.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Bailey, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Critical choice
results.creator_credit: Gary Toole, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. The film considers the cost of high-risk organ transplants and the allocation of scarce medical resources. A child is in need of a liver transplant. The child has only a 40% chance of surviving with the transplant, but a 100% chance of dying without it. How should society’s limited medical dollars be spent?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gary Toole, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Courage of one's convictions
results.creator_credit: Gil Cardinal, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern technology. Because of her religious convictions, a seventeen-year-old girl refuses medical treatment that will prolong her life. Her decision remains firm in spite of the pleas of her physician, who begins to question who has the right to determine a person’s life or death.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Cardinal, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Chronic problem
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film considers the chronic patient’s right to quality care, and the acutely ill patient’s right to a hospital bed. Jean is suffering from multiple sclerosis and is almost completely paralyzed. It seems that the only ones who care about her are the nurses. With the arrival of a patient in need of an operation, it becomes apparent that chronic patients have little priority.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
